intro: Dodonaea eriocarpa f. acuminata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hop萧, is a shrub native to Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in spikes, followed by small, woody fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats. The variety f. acuminata is distinguished by its more elongated and pointed leaf tips compared to other forms of Dodonaea eriocarpa.
